page.title: 08LOCAL MEMORIES OF YANWORTH
page.content: The oldest people can remember the {six wells and the village pump }_ now in need of some minor repairs. {Piped {water}arrived about 1930 / 1933 and is a private estate supply. {Toilets and {bathrooms}were installed about 1953. {Electricity }arrived October 1953. The powerful farm machinery kept in the village ensures the roads are seldom blocked by{ snow} but one man recalls helping with the team of six horses that pulled a wooden plough in the early years of the century. Until 1982 Yanworth was famous for its{opera production. }About 45 local young people camped in the village while practising for the Saturday and Sunday night productions of West Side Story, Oklahoma etc. in the big barn. The {allotments }_ once the pride and joy of the village _ reflect the changing leisure time interests.
